egg white alternately the mixture can be decoratively piped onto the egg whites using a pastry bag if you don t have a pastry bag try placing the mixture into a zip lock bag seal and then snip off a title: Roast Veg Pizza on a Cauliflower Base
ingredients: pizza crust base cauliflower approx  a large head of cauliflower or one small one ground chia seeds pulsin soya protein powder ground almonds nutritional yeast chia egg substitute  milled chia mixed with  water equivalent to eggs  dried mixed herbs salt and pepper tomato sauce topping  ground flaxseed this is optional but it helps thicken the sauce and  omega and fibre  sugarfree apple sauce  tomato   tamari  dried oregano salt and pepper garlic cloves crushed toppings the fun bit of course you can  what toppings you like here i have topped mine with roasted vegetables sliced beetroot cubes of roasted sweet potato red onion chunks red pepper chunksroasted with a little rapeseed oil for mins for  pizzas you will need large beetroot peeled sliced red onions red pepper  sweet potato basil pesto tofu available in supermarkets sliced  nutritional yeast
preparation: remove the leaves from the cauliflower and cut into chunks then using a blender or food processor blitz the cauliflower until it is finely  so that it resembles rice i e cauliflower crumb transfer the crumb into a steamer and steam for mins or microwave in a bowl with cling film with a hole or two on top for mins until soft  the  to fan line large baking sheets with greaseproof paper and a little coconut spray oil allow the cooked cauliflower crumb to cool before transferring into a clean tea towel and squeezing as  moisture as you can out  wring it you may need more than one tea towel transfer the dehydrated cauliflower crumb into a bowl and  the remaining pizza base  ground chia seeds protein powder i used pulsin soya protein powder ground almonds nutritional yeast chia egg substitute dried mixed herbs a large pinch of salt and plenty of freshly ground black pepper using your hands divide the pizza mixture in  and  directly on each baking sheet shape into a ball and then press down to form a round pizza base shape bake for mins until the bases are golden brown and starting to crisp a little at the edges if you want your base extra crispy  way through baking flip it over to ensure both sides are well baked whilst the base is baking  together the ground flaxseed sugar free apple sauce tomato purée tamari dried oregano garlic and season with salt and pepper  the tomato topping onto each of the pizza bases then top your pizza with your topping of choice i have chosen roasted vegetables and slices of basil pesto tofu sprinkle over with nutritional yeast turn the  up to fan and bake for a further mins i love to serve mine with a large handful of fresh rocket on top and a side salad  the key to making a great cauliflower crust pizza is by making a cauliflower crumb and then dehydrating it so that as  moisture is squeezed out as possible allowing the remaining crumb to be turned into a crispy pizza base if you don t squeeze out the moisture the base will be all soggy you will be surprised with the amount of liquid which comes out but this delicious grain free pizza is well worth the effort there are two ways you can dehydrate your cauliflower crumb the more  consuming is by putting the cooked cauliflower crumb in a tea towel or two and wringing out the moisture i think of this as stress relief alternatively if you are lucky enough to have a juicer you can  feed cauliflower florets through the juicer and collect the residual crumb and  this directly with the remaining pizza base  no need to  before using so why not give preparation: to  f vegan buttermilk measure the milk and the juice of lemon or apple cider vinegar let rest for  to curdle strawberries  the strawberries in a  bowl with   cane sugar and combine set aside for at least  the longer they rest the juicer more macerated they will become shortcakes dry  in a large mixing bowl combine the flour sugar baking powder and salt cut the oil or butter  the coconut oil and cut the oil into the flour using a fork or pastry blender when done flour should be lumpy with little balls of flour combine dry and  pour the vegan buttermilk into the flour mixture and  to combine don t overmix the dough   until combined flatten dough once dough is formed  it on a  floured flat surface using your hands flatten and mold the dough into a circle shape about inch thick a rolling pin will work too cut dough cut circles using a inch cookie cutter a  is ok too dip the cutter in flour before each cut to keep it from sticking leftover dough can be reshaped and cut you should get shortcakes prep for baking  the shortcakes on an ungreased baking sheet or lined with a silpat or parchement paper make sure the sides are touching each other this will make them cling to one another rising bigger and taller garnish biscuits brush the tops with a little almond milk and sprinkle with  cane sugar or turbinado the sugar will give the shortcake tops a nice crunchy biscuits you  also try  all purpose and  whole grain  don t skimp on the oil or butter tips for cutting biscuits to keep the dough from sticking to the cutter keep a small bowl or plate of flour nearby and dip the cutter into the flour shaking any loose flour away before making cuts don t twist the cutter when making cuts it creates a seal and the biscuits won t rise as well  adapted from title: HOW TO ROAST & STORE RED PEPPERS (OR ANY PEPPER REALLY!)
ingredients: peppers any color if making a large batch and storing in the freezer parchment paper air tight containers that are freezer safe for storing in jars vinegar plain balsamic whitered wine or apple cider mineral salt olive oil clean pint sized mason jars
preparation: prepping peppers there are two ways to prepare your peppers for roasting the first is to   the whole pepper seeds stem and all this will work with all roasting s the second is to slice the peppers in  lengthwise remove the stem and seeds and  on the baking sheet cut side down use this for the  and or when using a baking sheet these peppers require no flipping only rotating of the baking sheet this is my favorite way of roasting peppers roasting s    to  f line a baking sheet with parchment or a silpat  peppers on baking sheet bake inches from the flame if using an electric  or there is no flame  baking sheet on the middle rack  peppers for  turning at least once during  using sturdy tongs if peppers are sliced in  no need to turn  rotate the baking sheet  they are ready when charred blackened and blistered whole peppers will still be full of air and puffy once removed from the  as the peppers cool they will deflate and become wrinkly looking broiler i used to have an  where the broiler was underneath the  now mine is in the  either way turn broiler to  high or  if yours is by numbers and char peppers turning every so often until browned and blackened if you ve prepped your peppers by slicing in  no need turn the peppers  adjust the baking sheet turning it to get all the peppers charred this may take anywhere from  open grill  whole peppers on their sides over an open flame on the grill turning every now and then until nicely charred all over depending on how big your grill is will determine how many you can do at one  stove top if roasting  or peppers you can  it over the gas burner of your stove i suppose you  do peppers utilizing each burner  pepper on its side and adjust the flame so it licks the peppers keep an eye on it and turn it as needed to blacken and char about this tends to be a more  consuming since you have to be so watchful steaming peeling while peppers are hot from the  carefully  them in a bowl and cover with a plate or use a pot with lid the goal is to steam the peppers making the skin peel easily let the peppers steam for about  once peppers are cool remove the skins stems and seeds i find it easiest to peel the pepper from the bottom to the top a few seeds left are fine do not run peppers under water to clean you ll lose most of the roasted flavor that you worked so hard get keep as  of the pepper juices as you can if storing leftovers from here you can use right away to make hummus romesco soups layer on sandwiches and toss in salads  storing rerfrigerator great for short term storage keep leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a days if you coat them with a little oil they will for a couple of weeks you can even  some of the pepper juices to the container to  be safe at the first sign of mold or spoilage throw away  if storing for longer you have a couple simple options freezing this is my favorite of long term storing as it is not blended with any other flavors it s super easy to do and they thaw out amazingly well freeze your peppers in a tightly sealed container they thaw out pretty fast once removed from the freezer making this a nice way of preserving your precious peppers this of storing is a neutral way of keeping the full roasted flavor intact as they won t be tainted with any other flavors i would suggest cutting and placing a small piece of parchment paper between the peppers for easy removal will last up to months vinegar this is will leave your peppers with a little bit of tang from the vinegar in some cases it may overpower them but it s a great way to store them use these peppers for sauces dips and soups  peppers in a jar with a little salt vinegar and pepper juices to do this you ll want to sprinkle your peppers with a generous pinch of mineral salt and  well  inch of vinegar at the bottom of your pint sized mason jar  peppers leaving about inches headspace using the handle of a spoon or fork poke along the inside edges of the jar to release air bubbles this is important pour reserved pepper juices over top so peppers are completely covered leaving inch room  about inch of olive oil over top to keep air out leaving inch headspace seal and  towards the back of the refrigerator will be good for up to months  even a little longer if you see any sign of mold or spoilage throw away

ingredients: usm   vegan butter i recommend miyokos small yellow onion or large shallot finely diced cloves garlic minced lbs mushrooms  cremini ends trimmed and sliced  flour  dry white wine  lowsodium vegetable broth  vegan sour cream   parsley plus more to serve salt pepper to taste oz pasta use your favorite straight small andor curvy
preparation: pasta  the noodles according to package directions until al dente drain reserving  of pasta water stroganoff  the butter in a  pot over  high   onion and saute until golden about   the garlic and mushrooms  another  or until mushrooms begin to sweat down a bit  the flour stirring to fully incorporate so there are no white streaks  for  stir in the wine and broth bring to a gentle boil reduce  to   another  or until the sauce has slightly thickened stir in the sour cream and parsley season with salt and pepper to taste assemble  the pasta to the mushroom sauce toss to combine  in a little pasta water as needed to loosen the sauce alternatively  pasta to individual bowls and spoon the creamy sauce overtop store leftovers can be stored in the refrigerator for up to days freeze for up to months let thaw before reheating
